wikipedia_page.main: George Brown Barbour FGS FRSE FRSSA (1890–1977) was an internationally renowned Scottish geologist and educator.

response: During all these years, Teilhard contributed considerably to the constitution of an international network of research in human paleontology related to the whole of eastern and southeastern Asia. He would be particularly associated in this task with two friends, Davidson Black and the Scot George Brown Barbour. Often he would visit France or the United States, only to leave these countries for further expeditions.
* George Brown Barbour, (1890–1977), British geologist, discoverer of the Xiaochangliang site

In 1889 he married Margaret Nelson Brown (1864-1930). Their son George Brown Barbour (1890-1977) became a geologist, spending time in America and China, and is known as the discoverer of the Xiaochangliang site.
